title: Peckforton Castle and Peckforton Hills Walking Route

images.title: Espresso Addict / Pasture with view of Bulkeley and Peckforton Hills, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pasture with view of Bulkeley and Peckforton Hills. Sloping cattle pasture descending from an unnamed 135 metre elevation. A dry brook runs along the bottom of the valley (nearest line of bushes) with the A534 concealed by a hedge beyond. Bulkeley Hill is on the left, with the Peckforton Hills behind it (right)

images.title: Stephen Charles / View of Beeston Castle from Peckforton Castle., via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View of Beeston Castle from Peckforton Castle. Photo taken from the highest tower at Peckforton Castle.

images.title: Bryan Pready / Foxes keep watch from Peckforton Hill, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Foxes keep watch from Peckforton Hill

images.title: Eirian Evans / Peckforton Horses, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Horses on Peckforton Hill - this part of Cheshire has many horses.

images.title: Jeff Buck / The courtyard of Peckforton Castle
images.caption: Peckforton Castle. This Victorian country house was built in the style of a medieval castle during the 19th century. It is Grade I listed. The building is now a hotel hosting weddings, conferences and other functions.

images.title: Jeff Buck / The outer wall of Peckforton Castle
images.caption: The outer wall of the castle

description: Explore the Peckforton Castle Estate and the Peckforton Hills on this walk in Cheshire. The walk makes use of the Sandstone Trail to take you along woodland trails with great views of the surrounding Cheshire countryside from the elevated Sandstone Ridge. If you head north along the ridge you could also visit the ruins of the 13th century Beeston Castle. It's a short climb with fabulous views over the beautiful countryside of the Cheshire Plain. If you were to head south along the trail you would soon come to Bickerton Hill and Maiden Castle where there are more great views and the Iron Age hill fort of Maiden Castle. The circular Burwardsley Walk starts from the nearby village and climbs to the castle as well as exploring Beeston Castle, Bickerton Hill and the nearby Bulkeley Hill .
